meanings.definition: Made an exact imitation of something valuable with the intention to deceive or defraud.
meanings.sent1: The criminal counterfeited money to trick people.
meanings.sent2: She was caught because she counterfeited official documents.
meanings.sent3: The artist counterfeited a famous painting for fun.
meanings.sent4: His smile counterfeited happiness, but his eyes revealed sadness.
meanings.sent5: The counterfeit product was so well-made that it fooled everyone.

meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper sold a counterfeited watch.
meanings.sent2: The counterfeit purse looked real at first glance.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit sunglasses made him look like a movie star.
meanings.sent4: Her counterfeit smile did not reach her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The counterfeit jewelry tarnished quickly, revealing its true nature.
